executive_summary: The Finance and Insurance sector plays a vital role in facilitating necessary financial transactions between consumers, businesses and government agencies. The core services provided by operators in this sector include providing insurance products needed by businesses and consumers to legally operate corporations and assets; offering, borrowing and depository services needed to finance new projects and safely save money; and investing to create and preserve investors' assets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Monetary Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: At the onset of the pandemic in early 2020, financial markets went into turmoil. The Federal Reserve lowered interest rates in 2020 to ease the global liquidity crisis and financial turmoil. The lower rates increased the value of assets such as stocks and cryptocurrencies as both individuals and institutional investors increased their investments.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Lower Interest Rates Made Debt Cheaper
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Easy access to cheap money increased the purchasing of various goods and assets from both institutional and retail investors. People bought more cars, houses and various things.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Exuberant House Market of Recent Years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The shut downs in the pandemic pushed workers to the suburbs and countryside. The low interest rates made it cheap for individuals to take out mortgages, puffing up housing prices. The current rate hikes are decreasing the quantity of house loans and by extension home insurance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Federal Reserve Increasing Interest Rates to Control Rampant Inflation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The lingering supply chain issues and global energy crisis have created historically high inflation. In 2022, the Fed began hiking interest rates after lowering them in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Higher interest rates increase interest income for various businesses across the sector but also lower demand for industries that issue out loans.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Fuel Investor Uncertainty
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve is expected to continue raising interest rates until it controls inflation. The overall uncertainty is bad for investor confidence. Higher interest rates will increase demand for bonds and less risky assets but lower demand for stocks and risky assets. Similarly, higher rates will bring in higher interest income for certain operators but might also diminish the quantity of loans issued.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technological Change Puts More Onus on Cyber Security
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Technology is becoming essential to modern finance and insurance operations, exposing them to cyber security risks. Several operators have highlighted cyber security as a risk to the stability of financial systems. As the finance and insurance sector increases its reliance on digital software the higher the cyber risks will be.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulation from the Federal Government is Expected to Keep Increasing
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The finance and insurance sectors are still living in the shadow of the Great Recession. The 2010 Dodd-Frank Act is still actively restricting many in the sector. The Government will increase regulating the industry as the share of the retail investor market keeps growing.

industry_definition: This sector comprises operators primarily engaged in financial transactions and in facilitating financial transactions. Three principal types of activities are identified, including raising funds by taking deposits, issuing securities and, in the process, incurring liabilities.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Consumer confidence index

key_trends: As the economy continues to recover from the pandemic, per capita disposable income will increase. This will lead to increased financial activity by consumers, which will be processed and facilitated by operators in the sector.

Higher interest rates have a varied effect on the sector. Higher interest rates increase interest income for various businesses across the sector. But higher rates also lower demand for industries that issue out loans.
Regulation is still heavily influenced by both the Great Depression and Great Recession. The government wants to ensure financial crises don't occur.
The Finance and Insurance sector only receives direct assistance in financial emergencies. The last time the industry received big direct government assistance was in the great financial crisis.

Consumers and businesses have increased their demand for financing provided by operators that provide these services despite rising interest rates. But, if on the quest to curb inflation, rates get too high, demand for these services will fall.
Operators in the sector provide consumers with debit and credit cards to make purchases and the banking and depository services they need on a daily basis.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Operators in the sector provide consumers with debit and credit cards to make purchases and the banking and depository services they need on a daily basis. Operators also provide them with mortgage to purchase home.

Businesses have similar financial services needs to consumers. Businesses need banking services to make and receive payments for goods and services. These transactions must also be validated by payment processors in the sector. Businesses seek out banking services to finance their day-to-day operations and potentially expand their operations. Businesses need to purchase various lines of insurance to insure their business and employees.

Government entities also require the services of operators in the sector. Government entities have relatively constant need from banking and depository services provided by operators in the sector. Government agencies seek out investment banks to help them underwriting municipal bonds to help finance local projects.
Other customers hold a small market share and include clients that are involved in a one-time, niche-type transactional service.

products_and_services.product_description: Insurance products play a vital role in the overall management of risk in the economy. Lines of insurance offered by operators in the sector can help mitigate risk with financial compensation.

tier_1_suppliers: Semiconductor Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Professional, Scientific and Technical Services in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Database, Storage & Backup Software Publishing in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Credit Intermediation and Related Activities are Essential to the Economy and Will Always be Needed
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Access to credit provided by operators in this sector is also critical for the economy to continue to function properly.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Securities, Commodity Contracts and Other Financial Investments are a Small but Vital Segment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Similar to operators that provide credit intermediation services, operators that provide securities servicing, commodity contracts and other financial investments provide crucial financing and savings services for consumers and businesses.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast accounts for the highest number of establishments compared to its population share.

regulations_points.regulation_title: 2010 Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: The most significant change the sector underwent has been the passing of the 2010 Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.
Basel III is an international regulatory standard that was passed at the beginning of the period.

basis_points.basis_title: Wide array of products and services
basis_points.basis_description: The sector offers a wide array of products and services to downstream consumers.

basis_points.basis_title: Technological networks and economies of scale
basis_points.basis_description: Operators that can improve their technological networks can achieve economies of scale.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Wide array of products and services
concentration_points.concentration_description: The sector offers a wide array of products and services.
Some industries display a low level of market share concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs are Limited Across the Sector
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are expected to decrease.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Most industries in this sector are labor-intensive
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Highly skilled and educated workers are integral.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Higher prevailing interest rates increase borrowing costs.

FAQs.question: How diversified are your product offerings compared to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Financial services companies provide a wide array of services to consumers.

FAQs.question: How do you emphasize the value of your company's services?
FAQs.answer: Financial service companies emphasize their value by helping tailor products.
